thread.title: InventHelp Device Provides an Alternative Method of Computer Typing (JMC-1711)
thread.title_full: InventHelp Device Provides an Alternative Method of Computer Typing (JMC-1711) - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: InventHelp Device Provides an Alternative Method of Computer Typing (JMC-1711)
text:
A leading inventor service company, InventHelp is submitting the TYPEZE to companies in the hopes of a good faith review.
PITTSBURGH, PA
So many people are used to texting on a cell-phone keypad that regular computer keyboards seem slow and cumbersome. "In order to please this wide demographic, I decided that there needs to be an alternative way to type on computers," Espanola, N.M.
The patent-pending TYPEZE enables a user to type on a computer in a quicker, easier manner. It has a familiar feel, and eliminates the need for a slow, cumbersome keyboard. Overall, it saves time and effort. The device is easy to use and ideal for users age 30 and younger.
The original design was submitted to the Telemarketing office of InventHelp. It is currently available for licensing or sale to manufacturers or marketers. For more information, write Dept. 14-JMC-1711, InventHelp, 217 Ninth Street, Pittsburgh, PA 15222, or call (412) 288-1300 ext. 1368. Learn more about InventHelp's Invention Submission Services at http://www.InventHelp.com - https://www.youtube.com/user/inventhelp
